data.title: Animation — Coney Island USA
data.meta_description: And a Little for Me Lonely Island Low Down Larry Versus the Giant Reptile Rat and Croc! Best Friends Forever Crystal Galaxy Enforcers Pea on the Moon Jim's Interview Nalb Noum Strawberries Skate Fast Turn Left Faze A Tree Once Grew Here Sürgünlik (Exile) nineteen ninety three Extension   Sold Out
data.text:
And a Little for Me

Directed by Kathryn Roake, USA, Animation, 5:40

What begins as a typical, summer beach day: an afternoon of surf, sun and dinner, escalates into a theft and a riot. Why?

Lonely Island

Directed by Kristie Kish, USA, Animation, 4:22, Brooklyn Premiere

Lonely Island is a mixed-media short film about a starving man washed ashore on a mysterious island where he befriends a crab who helps him survive. A nightmarish fever–dream narrative taking place within a collage jungle and painted sea, Lonely Island is a tale that reflects humanity and its relationship to the non-human world.

Low Down Larry Versus the Giant Reptile

Directed by Sammy Verni, USA, Animation, 7:00, World Premiere

In their latest adventure together, Larry and Spike set out in a time machine to be the first to bring a living dinosaur back with them to present day. They've already been to the Moon and back, but this time have they gone too far?

Rat and Croc! Best Friends Forever

Directed by Owen Andrejco, USA, Animation, 2:50, Brooklyn Premiere

A psychotic New York City subway dwelling rat, “Rat”, and his empty headed crocodilian best friend, “Croc”, prepare for a vindictive journey of revenge before shenanigans ensue.

Nalb Noum

Directed by Xzaviah J. Stone Sr., USA, Animation, 10:07, NYC Premiere

An arcane massacre on the Black community is unfolding as a black teen and his friends journey to discover the truth behind an old folklore.

Skate Fast Turn Left

Directed by Mary Hawkins, USA, Animation, 1:15

Two friends, Fifi Fleshwound and Little Mary Switchblade, have a quick conversation about their roller derby years... Created for Things Took A Turn, an animation anthology that challenges artists of marginalized genders to create new animated short stories by twisting familiar narratives.

A Tree Once Grew Here

Directed by Johnnie Semerad, USA, Animation, 6:59

“A Tree Once Grew Here” combines captivating visuals, animation, and imagery, to tell a tale that transcends language. We are reminded that we must rebalance harmony and nurture our planet; because we can no longer afford not to.

Sürgünlik (Exile)

Directed by Jeremiah Dickey, USA, Animation, 2:15

This animated excerpt from documentary “Jamala: Songs of Freedom” illustrates the plight of a single mother and her children during the Soviet purge of Crimean Tatars at the end of WW2. Based on an account passed down three generations and related by her great grand-daughter, Susana Alimivna Jamaladinova (better known as popular Ukrainian singer Jamala).

Extension

Directed by Wenya Chen, USA, Animation, 9:54, Brooklyn Premiere

"Extension" is a gripping film that delves into the journey of a traumatized young woman as she confronts her inner struggles, seeking to find a sense of harmony and personal growth.

All ticket sales are non-refundable and WILL CALL only, to be picked up day of screening, at our box office at 1208 Surf Avenue. TICKETS WILL NOT SHIP. There are no extra service fees for online purchase. Please check your junk or spam folder if you do not receive an email confirmation, in your inbox.
